prompt:
Describe the spatial relationships in this diagram.

CONTAINMENT: Which text labels are inside or outside each closed curve?
CONNECTIONS: Which text labels are connected by lines? Note any branching or unconnected lines.
BOUNDARY CROSSINGS: Do any lines cross the boundaries of closed curves?
NESTING: Are any closed curves nested inside others?

Do not interpret meaning. Only describe what you see spatially.
evaluation:
# Spatial Relationships in the Diagram

## CONTAINMENT:
- **Top closed curve**: Contains the text "fears" and "snake" (with "snake" positioned to the right)
- **Bottom closed curve**: Contains the text "hates" and "snake" (with "snake" positioned to the right)
- **Outside all curves**: The text "man" appears to the left of the closed curves

## CONNECTIONS:
- A line connects "man" to both closed curves at their left edges (branching point)
- Inside the top curve: a line connects "fears" to "snake"
- Inside the bottom curve: a line connects "hates" to "snake"
- The word "fears" has a strikethrough line crossing it horizontally

## BOUNDARY CROSSINGS:
- The line from "man" crosses into both closed curves at their left boundaries
- The connecting lines between text labels (fears→snake, hates→snake) remain within their respective curves

## NESTING:
- No closed curves are nested inside others
- The two elongated oval/rounded rectangular curves are positioned parallel to each other (top and bottom arrangement)
- Both curves are at the same hierarchical level
